body_html:
Do you mind posting the error you are seeing?
The script follows the regex match with this check:
if os.path.exists('%s.%s' % (cudnn_path_from_ldconfig, tf_cudnn_version)):, which is why it was looking for the link for libcudnn.so instead of libcudnn.so.<tf_cudnn_version>.
body_text:
Do you mind posting the error you are seeing?
The script follows the regex match with this check:
if os.path.exists('%s.%s' % (cudnn_path_from_ldconfig, tf_cudnn_version)):, which is why it was looking for the link for libcudnn.so instead of libcudnn.so.<tf_cudnn_version>.
body:
Do you mind posting the error you are seeing? 
The script follows the regex match with this check:
`if os.path.exists('%s.%s' % (cudnn_path_from_ldconfig, tf_cudnn_version)):`, which is why it was looking for the link for libcudnn.so instead of libcudnn.so.<tf_cudnn_version>.
